NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Laboratory, optical and precision equipments (excl. glasses)

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B03

TI_TEXT.P: Лабораторно, оптично и прецизно оборудване (без стъклени изделия)

TITLE.P: Cryo-free Dilution Fridge for Andersen Lab

SHORT_DESCR.P: A measurement set-up is sought that allows for operating a range of novel superconducting qubits and hybrid superconducting/semiconductor qubits with the highest fidelities. The measurements will include design and characterization of readout and gate operations. These operation will rely on low-noise DC voltage control, low-frequency flux control and microwave control up to 18 GHz. Good thermalization of cables and cold fingers at temperatures below 10 mK is required for efficient initialization and high performance of the qubits. The expected mode of operation will include both many short cooldowns for characterization of new devices, thus fast warm-up and cooldown times is required. Each cooldown must yield reproducible performance for comparison between cooldowns. Once a suitable device has been identified, a few very long cooldowns are needed allowing for full characterization of multiple different gate schemes.

A measurement set-up is sought that allows for operating a range of novel superconducting qubits and hybrid superconducting/semiconductor qubits with the highest fidelities. The measurements will include design and characterization of readout and gate operations. These operation will rely on low-noise DC voltage control, low-frequency flux control and microwave control up to 18 GHz. Good thermalization of cables and cold fingers at temperatures below 10 mK is required for efficient initialization and high performance of the qubits. The expected mode of operation will include both many short cooldowns for characterization of new devices, thus fast warm-up and cooldown times is required. Each cooldown must yield reproducible performance for comparison between cooldowns. Once a suitable device has been identified, a few very long cooldowns are needed allowing for full characterization of multiple different gate schemes.
